variants.Description in input context: A missense mutation in the SNCA gene (c.109G>A, p.G37E) associated with Parkinson's disease
A pathogenic variant in TARDBP (c.1055G>A, p.G352D) linked to amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS)

Material used.Material Name: Postmortem brain tissue from Parkinson's disease patients
Material used.Description: Immunohistochemistry was performed on postmortem brain tissue from Parkinson's disease patients and healthy controls.

Readout description.Result Description: Increased alpha-synuclein aggregation observed in brain tissue with the p.G37E variant compared to controls.

Biological replicates.Description: Five biological replicates were analyzed from different patients.

Technical replicates.Description: Each slide was analyzed in duplicate by two independent pathologists.

Basic positive control.Description: Tissue from patients with confirmed Parkinson's disease was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Tissue from healthy controls without neurological disease was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Chi-square test was used to compare aggregation levels between groups.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Alpha-synuclein aggregation below 20% of total protein

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Alpha-synuclein aggregation above 50% of total protein

Material used.Description: HEK293 cells were transfected with plasmids expressing wild-type or mutant TARDBP.

Readout description.Result Description: Reduced TARDBP protein stability and increased cleavage fragments in cells with the p.G352D variant.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were conducted across different transfection experiments.

Technical replicates.Description: Each gel was run in triplicate with three independent protein extractions.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type TARDBP overexpression was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector transfection was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One-way ANOVA with post-hoc Tukey's test was used to compare protein levels.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: TARDBP protein levels within 10% of wild-type controls

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: TARDBP protein levels below 30% of wild-type controls
